title: Add Google Search Console verification meta tag to homepage head

requirements.text: Add the following Google Search Console site verification meta tag to the document <head> so it is present on the home page load: <meta name="google-site-verification" content="jiX9_ApHGMseCG4mi-MUNxWqe4-XW7LiWlKq_81pkwQ" />. Implement this in the static HTML entrypoint (frontend/index.html) within the <head> section.

quotes: <meta name="google-site-verification" content="jiX9_ApHGMseCG4mi-MUNxWqe4-XW7LiWlKq_81pkwQ" /> add this to home page

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html contains <meta name="google-site-verification" content="jiX9_ApHGMseCG4mi-MUNxWqe4-XW7LiWlKq_81pkwQ" /> inside the <head> element.
When loading the app in a browser, View Source shows the verification meta tag in the <head>.
No React runtime errors or TypeScript build errors are introduced.

constraints: Do not edit any frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx and frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)).
Keep all backend code unchanged; no backend changes are required for adding an HTML meta tag.
nonGoals: Adding any other SEO tags (Open Graph, Twitter cards, canonical URLs) beyond the exact meta tag provided by the user.
Changing routing, page components, or content on the marketing page.
